DOCNAME: CASE OF PIŠTOROVÁ v. THE CZECH REPUBLIC
CONCLUSION: Preliminary objection dismissed (Article 35-1 - Effective domestic remedy);Remainder inadmissible;Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Civil proceedings;Article 6-1 - Reasonable time);Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed (Article 41 - Causal link;Pecuniary damage;Just satisfaction);Non-pecuniary damage - award (Article 41 - Non-pecuniary damage;Just satisfaction)
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . The applicant 's parents owned a house with a garden and private road . On DATE they donated their property to the ORG . The property was then administered by GPE ( město GPE ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant requested the Municipality to conclude a restitution agreement with her , pursuant to ORG ( hereinafter “ the LAW ” ) . The GPE refused .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( okresní soud ) , after having held CARDINAL hearings on DATE and CARDINAL DATE , dismissed the applicant 's action for restitution of the property in question , introduced on DATE and completed on CARDINAL and DATE , stating that the contract of donation had not been concluded under pressure , as envisaged by the LAW .
CARDINAL . On DATE the České Budĕjovice Regional Court ( krajský soud ) , upon the applicant 's appeal of CARDINAL DATE , quashed this judgment and remitted the case to ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE and on CARDINAL and DATE ORG held hearings .

CARDINAL . On DATE it ordered the Municipality to restore the property to the applicant . The court , having assessed certain additional evidence , found that the applicant 's parents had signed the contract of donation under pressure .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , on the defendant 's appeal of CARDINAL DATE , to which the applicant had made her comments on DATE , modified ORG judgment , dismissing the applicant 's claim for restitution . It found that the GPE had not owned the house on DATE , as provided for in the LAW , and that it had not been transferred to the LOC after the entry into force of Act no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL with the obligation to restore it to the former owners .

CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the judgment was notified to the applicant who , on DATE , filed an appeal on points of law ( dovolání ) with ORG ( Vrchní soud ) , raising the question of the position of the GPE as defendant .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , to which the applicant 's case had been transferred for reasons of material competence on DATE , dismissed the applicant 's appeal , endorsing the reasons given by ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a constitutional appeal ( ústavní stížnosti ) claiming that the proceedings had been unreasonably long , and that her right to a fair and public hearing respecting the principle of equality of arms had been violated .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( PERSON ) dismissed her appeal , stating inter alia that there had been no unjustified delays in the proceedings . It considered that any delay in the proceedings before ORG had been caused by the amendments to LAW ( občanský soudní řád ) . The decision was notified to the applicant 's lawyer on DATE .
